title: Tucker Carlson says he'll launch new show on Twitter
description: Conservative commentator and former Fox News host Tucker Carlson is launching a new version of his show on Twitter, he said Tuesday.

title: Rep. George Santos is facing federal charges, sources say
description: Justice Department prosecutors have charged Rep. George Santos with federal offenses, three sources say.

title: Texas mall shooter was expelled from military over mental health concerns
description: After entering basic training at Fort Benning, Georgia, in June 2008, Mauricio Garcia was seen by a doctor who identified mental health issues. Garcia, then 18, failed a psychiatric evaluation.

title: Trump found liable for sexually abusing and defaming E. Jean Carroll in civil trial and is ordered to pay $5 million
description: A New York jury on Tuesday found former President Donald Trump liable for sexually abusing writer E. Jean Carroll in a Manhattan department store in the 1990s, but not liable for her alleged rape.

title: CNBC anchor Hadley Gamble, who accused former NBCUniversal CEO Jeff Shell of sexual harassment, leaving company
description: Hadley Gamble, the CNBC anchor who accused former NBCUniversal CEO Jeff Shell of sexual harassment and sex discrimination, is leaving the company.

title: How Carroll verdict may contribute to Trump’s political narrative
description: NBC’s Garrett Haake reports on how the civil case brought by E. Jean Carroll, combined with numerous other legal cases brought against former President Donald Trump, will embolden his political narrative, which he calls a “witch hunt.”

title: Harlan Crow declines to give Senate committee a list of gifts he gave to Clarence Thomas
description: Republican donor Harlan Crow on Monday wrote in a letter to the Senate Finance Committee that he will not provide a list of gifts he had given to Justice Thomas

title: Understanding the verdict in E. Jean Carroll’s decades-old claim against Trump
description: Jurors found former President Donald Trump liable for defamation and sexually abusing E. Jean Carroll in a department store in the 1990s. NBC News’ Danny Cevallos explains how Carroll was able to bring forth the allegation after several decades and how Trump’s past comments on "Access Hollywood" took a role in the case.

title: Trump found liable for sexually abusing E. Jean Carroll
description: A jury in New York has found former President Trump liable for sexually abusing E. Jean Carroll in a department store in the 1990s and defaming her, but not liable for her alleged rape. The jury awarded her $5 million in damages for battery and defamation claims in the civil lawsuit. NBC's Laura Jarrett reports.

title: Dianne Feinstein set to return to the Senate after a nearly 3-month absence due to health issues
description: California Sen. Dianne Feinstein is returning to the Senate after a nearly three-month absence due to health problems led to calls for her to resign.

title: Jury reaches verdict in E. Jean Carroll’s civil rape case against Trump
description: The jury has reached a verdict in E. Jean Carroll's rape and defamation civil suit against Donald Trump.

title: Leaked Google engineer memo warns that Big Tech could lose AI race to the little guys
description: A leaked memo from a Google employee makes a bold claim that’s taking hold in Silicon Valley and beyond: Big Tech’s advantage in artificial intelligence is shrinking quickly.

title: Utah mom who wrote a children's book on grief after her husband died is now charged with murdering him
description: A Utah mother who wrote a children's book about how to cope with grief after her husband's death last year is accused of poisoning him with a lethal dose of fentanyl after serving him a celebratory Moscow Mule.

title: FBI says it has sabotaged hacking tool created by elite Russian spies
description: The FBI has sabotaged a suite of malicious software used by elite Russian spies, U.S. authorities said on Tuesday, providing a glimpse of the digital tug-of-war between two cyber superpowers.

title: Jury begins deliberations in E. Jean Carroll's rape and defamation civil suit against Trump
description: The jury in E. Jean Carroll's civil suit alleging Donald Trump raped and defamed her has started deliberations in the case.

title: South Carolina police shooting survivor says deputies opened fire on him and his mother 'immediately'
description: A South Carolina man who survived being shot nine times by sheriff’s deputies alleges in a newly-filed lawsuit that he was sitting in his pickup truck and talking to his mother when the officers descended on them “like cowboys from a John Wayne movie.”

title: New breast cancer guidelines say to start screenings at age 40, instead of 50
description: Women over 40 should get breast cancer screenings every other year, according to the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force. But some doctors think scans should be annual.

title: AI-generated phone calls and other scams to look out for
description: NBC’s Vicky Nguyen shares tips to outsmart phone scams and malware-filled ads that use artificial intelligence in malicious ways.

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried seeks dismissal of indictment
description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried sought a dismissal of criminal charges against him in a court filing late Monday.

title: Senate Democrats ask billionaire Harlan Crow to list gifts to Clarence Thomas and any other justices
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee asked billionaire Harlan Crow to list gifts to Clarence Thomas and other Supreme Court justices.

title: Experts release guidelines on teen screen time, social media limits
description: The American Psychological Association is releasing new guidelines about how much time adolescents should spend online and ways to help them have a healthier mindset while using social media. TODAY’s Jenna Bush Hager shares details.

title: 'Trump was great at this': How conservatives transformed a Colorado school district
description: The Woodland Park, Colorado, school board faces growing opposition, including from lifelong GOP voters upset by a lack of transparency.

title: Richard Dreyfuss says Oscar's new diversity standards 'make me vomit'
description: Oscar-winning actor Richard Dreyfuss issued some criticism for the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences’ new diversity and inclusion standards, saying that the updated requirements for Oscar contention “make me vomit.”

title: Biden to meet with congressional leaders on debt ceiling as default looms
description: President Joe Biden and congressional leaders will meet Tuesday to discuss the debt ceiling.

title: Russia holds scaled-back Victory Day celebrations under shadow of Ukraine war
description: President Vladimir Putin will address Victory Day in Moscow's Red Square on Tuesday but celebrations have been canceled over fear of attacks amid his war in Ukraine.

title: Texas House panel advances bill to raise age to buy semi-automatic rifles
description: A House committee in Texas advanced a measure Monday that would raise the minimum age to buy semi-automatic rifles in an unexpected shift after nine people died in a shooting at a Dallas-area outlet mall over the weekend.

title: Teens should be trained in media literacy and limit their screen time, psychologists say in new guidelines
description: The American Psychological Association released a set of 10 recommendations for adolescents’ use of social media Tuesday.

title: Biden calls for 'fair deal' for striking Hollywood writers
description: Biden called for a “fair deal” for Hollywood’s striking writers as he hosted a screening of the the upcoming streaming series “American Born Chinese.”
